comments: The number of simple labeled graphs on n nodes whose connected components are stars. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 10 2011
references: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Cambridge, Vol. 2, 1999; see Problem 5.15(b).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Vaclav Kotesovec, Asymptotic solution of the equations using the Lambert W-function
Vladimir Kruchinin, D. V. Kruchinin, Composita and their properties , arXiv:1103.2582 [math.CO], 2011.
formula: a(n) = n!*sum((binomial(k,n-k)*2^(k-n)*(-1)^k+sum(binomial(k,j)*sum(j^(i-j)/(i-j)!*binomial(k-j,n-i-k+j)*(1/2)^(n-i-k+j)*(-1)^(k-j),i,j,n-k+j),j,1,k))/k!,k,1,n), n>0. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Sep 10 2010From _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 06 2014: (Start)a(n) ~ n^n / (exp(r^2/2 + n*r/(1+r)) * r^n * sqrt(r^2*(1+r)/n + 2+r-1/(1+r))), where r is the root of the equation r*(exp(r)*(1+r)-1-r) = n.(a(n)/n!)^(1/n) ~ exp(1/(2*LambertW(sqrt(n)/2))) / (2*LambertW(sqrt(n)/2)).(End)
mathematica: nn = 16; a = x Exp[x]; Range[0, nn]! CoefficientList[Series[Exp[a - x^2/2! - x], {x, 0, nn}], x] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 10 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 16 2000
